titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Woodward and Quita Woodward papers (series 26) 1920-1986
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Woodward and Quita Woodward papers (series 26)

bioghist.p: Gertrude Houston, daughter of Henry Howard Houston and Sallie Sherrerd Bonnell, married George Woodward, M.D., son of Stanley and Sarah Butler Woodward, in 1894. In 1911, Gertrude and George Woodward moved to Krisheim, the family estate in Chestnut Hill. The couple had five children: Henry Howard Houston, George Jr., Stanley, Charles, and Gertrude (Quita). Quita Woodward (1909-1934) died of Hodgkin's Disease. As a child, she was close friends with her cousin, Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Woodward family papers. Materials include: correspondence and invitations; election campaign materials for Dr. George Woodward; memorials of Quita Woodward's death, including a copy of a book entitled Quita, which was written by her mother; and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
